intro: Mapouria lavanchiei, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil. It prefers full sun and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Mapouria lavanchiei is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
